Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: MOFF5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here en route to a holiday. The staff upon check in were excellent. They were very friendly, welcoming and polite. We were treated to an upgrade and had no issues at all during check in. The bellboys were very helpful and friendly too. The room was spacious, modern, extremely clean and very comfortable. The gym was one of the best I have used in an airport hotel and the hotel itself is very modern. The only thing that sadly let this hotel down for me was the breakfast. The staff here were very rude and didn't welcome or offer help to any of the guests when they came in. They just stood and gossiped amongst themselves. This was a shame as everything else about the hotel was excellent. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling from Sabiha Gokcen Airport on an early morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport hotel.Incredible service and fine food for the late night stay.”
Reviews.Author: Serkan S
Reviews.Content: Incredible service and fine food for the late night stay.Quiet and clean environment.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: ekalcin
Reviews.Content: If you just need a hotel for a short stopover, then here you can find everything you need. Newly decorated rooms, very clean, quiet and spacy. Free wireless internet, rich breakfast buffet. Friendly staff who solve your problem immediately. Walking distance to the terminal, but takes 10 minutes, so better take free shuttle if you have laggages. Far from the city center, but there is a huge mall called viapor nereby, cost about 10 euro by taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet stay”
Reviews.Author: melissa1233
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights throughout our trip since it was such a great location. The walk from the terminal was maybe 5 minutes, which saved from having to use the shuttle service. The hotel staff was extremely friendly, always willing to help. Aysun was a great contact to make sure everything was booked correctly online. Gockan, the front reception clerk was extremely helpful. We had a day trip to Izmir and wanted to see Ephesus. The company that the hotel goes through wouldn't fit with our flight schedule, so he offered to help us find a company that would. He even offered to see if any of his friends on facebook would be willing to take us on a tour. This was superb service, and the day trip was great! Thank you Gockan. As for the rooms, they were extremely large with 2 double beds, a sofa, and a large desk that spread across one whole wall. The bathroom was also large; the shower was a little tall. I'm 5'1" and had to be careful getting out of the shower it was that tall. The rooms were SPOTLESS! I couldn't believe the great job the cleaning staff did. This hotel was so quiet it is hard to believe that it is connected to an airport! The hotel restaurant was very nice, however the buffets were pricey. It was a much better deal to order off of the more reasonable a la carte menu. Everything that we had there was excellent. The only complaint about the hotel has to be the scent machines. While it was a nice scent, it was a bit overwhelming in the lobby. The hotel is a bit far away from anything. Nearest mall was a 15 minute cab ride... Do not stay here if you are looking for nighttime entertainment. We had no need for it, so it was no issue for us. Our stay was excellent though and I would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a place near the airport. Again, thank you to all the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rajandani
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights as my flight into Sabiha International was arriving near midnight and I did not want to take chances with local taxis at that hour. Hotel is just outside the arrival at a distance of couple of minutes walk. As a matter of fact it is between passenger terminal and a VIP terminal. Hotel is modern and rooms are large with all modern amenities. Staff and service is great and very friendly. Hotel is clean and gives a very modern look. Everything in room works well. WiFi is available with password provided by hotel and it is surprisingly very fast and worked all the time. Breakfast spread was good and had large variety fruits, breads, cheese, salad and limited cooked variety. Hotel is also very moderately priced. One can even stay at this hotel and still do descent sightseeing and come back in the night. Hotel can call for local taxi from airport. Also airport is well connected to many other areas including Citry Centre (Taksim Square) by Havatas Bus service which is great. You are in city centre in just 12 TL. The service is great. The hotel is highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: N5CKP
Reviews.Content: This is my fifth stay at the ISG Airport Hotel in the last 9 months. I visit form the UK a lot on business. The hotel improves each time i come here. The rooms are spacious and very clean and the pricing is also very reasonable considering it is so close to the airport (it is actually connected). The food is good but the customer service is excellent. A very easy check in and always an easy check out (by the beautiful receptionists). I take a lot of internal flights to customers around Turkey so this hotel is ideally situated. Everything in my room always works (which frequent travelers will understand how rare this actually happens) I am currently staying here and i am here for two more nights and then it is back home to rainy England. I am already looking forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good for a Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jetcaptain
Reviews.Content: Practically in the terminal, new, large rooms, modern conveniences, ok restaurant, etc. Like everyone else says, for an airport hotel, it's surprisingly good. Gripes? Internet service has some ports blocked that will disable your email if you use a laptop application for email. For a modern airport hotel, I was suppressed the power outlets were not the multinational plug types, so you'll need an adaptor. All the non-smoking rooms are twin beds. (That's a first--what were they thinking?)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: islandlover39
Reviews.Content: We flew into Attaturk airport and needed to fly out early from SabaGocken so we decided to taxi over to stay at the ISG airport to eliminate hassels and it was definitely worth it, as it took us two hours to get there in peak traffic. Upon arrival we were greeted warmly and upgraded to a suite. The suite was a generous size, our only wish was that we had longer to enjoy it, for what we paid it was an absolute bargain. The AC worked well, the bed was comfortable and there was no noise to be heard from outside the room. We used the bar to enjoy a couple of local drinks and enjoyed the warmed nuts that were on offer to accompany the drinks. We then moved into the restaurant which again has nice food. Breakfast was nice too, with a range of different foods. We decided to walk to the airport since we had backpacks, which took all of four minutes. Do not stay here if you are wanting to visit Istanbul attractions though, it is just too far away. This is definitely a great transit hotel for those needing to be close the airport and I would definitely recommend it for those people.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay near airport”
Reviews.Author: susanned
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a free shuttle service (takes 3 minutes between airport and hotel), the breakfast buffet was the best we had in Turkey, the rooms are very fresh, stylish and spacious, great bathroom and it's quiet! Great hotel if you need to stay near the airport (remember that it can take over 1.5 hours from Sabiha Gokcen to Sultanahmnet, so if you have a relative late/early arrival/departure), then stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: lizard999
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on two occasions in July 2011 and were very impressed. The hotel is new and modern and gives the feel of a business hotel. Reception staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms are spacious and modern and spotlessly clean. The breakfast was self service and was good, mainly continental with cereals, meats, fruits but also a toaster and a small selection of hot food. The hotel is situated next to the airport and within walking distance of the exit doors (turn left as you exit arrivals and walk to the end of the building line. You will see the hotel to your left. Walk down one flight of stairs and you are there.) Although it is situated alongside the airport, NO plane noise was heard in either of the two rooms we used. There is nothing other than the airport within walking distance however, if you have a few spare hours, a taxi to the Viaport shopping mall is a must. Taxi costs 10-13 Tl (approx Â£4-Â£5 each way) and takes about 10mins. The only minor downside is that there is no atmosphere in the hotel, but as a one night stopover type hotel don't let this put you off. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for an airport hotel; great staff”
Reviews.Author: kievexpat
Reviews.Content: We had driven into Istanbul from Trabzon - about 13 hours of driving with 2 kids. We arrived to the outskirts of town at 8.30pm, and had no hotel reservations, thinking it would be easy to find a hotel in the area. Not so easy! Were getting increasingly worried about where to stay, when we decided to swing by the airport and see what property was there. ISG was clean, bright, available, and very reasonably priced. The staff was great, food was very good, clean, nice rooms. If you need a hotel near the airport - this is the one!

Reviews.Title: “OK for one night”
Reviews.Author: GBains
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a result of missed flight connection. We were shipped here and stayed free of charge. Hotel is clean and comfortable but has no atmosphere, as we only saw it in the dark we couldnt comment too much. The staff were ok but not too friendly. Its an airport hotel, what more do you need

Reviews.Title: “Very Professional”
Reviews.Author: mountt
Reviews.Content: I just wish pass on some of my thoughts about your Hotel. I travel all over the world on business each year and stay in Hotels about 250 days per year. Just thought you should know that ISG AIRPORT HOTEL, Istanbul Sabiha Gokcen International Airport 34912 Pendik Istanbul - Turkey is one of my favorite places to stay. Service by your staff and accommodations are always excellent

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, professional, courteous, welcoming”
Reviews.Author: tadorna-tadorna
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, walk from hotel to the airport (or take courtesy minibus), yet silent, very spacious rooms, foyers, common areas, restaurant etc. Staff were very friendly, 100% professional, wanting to help, smiling. We were able to negotiate a reduction from the standard tariff. Breakfast choices truly extensive. Great art-work, but on balance I would also like something which is local and distinct to Instanbul . Beware of consumables in room. They are chargeable - a tea-bag costs three euros (yes - per tea-bag). Despite this, an outstanding, nigh-perfect service. Would certainly stay again for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay near ISG airport”
Reviews.Author: Fingersonfire
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new and very comfortable: large and clean rooms, beautiful common area, professional and kind staff. We were given a suite instead of a standard room at the same price, and we were picked up and dropped off at the airport without surplus. Just one minute from the airport, it's the perfect choice for a single night.

Reviews.Title: “A very poor service from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Turkeyites
Reviews.Content: We were unfortunately delayed at Sabiha Gokcen airport on Sunday 18th July en-route to the U.K. The airline concerned placed us into the ISG Airport Hotel, and I have to say, apart from the hotel being quite new, with adequate rooms, the service was quite appalling, and it is not an experience that I would wish to repeat - there are clearly much better hotels in the area that I would suggest travellers use. Lunch was not included in our stay arranged by the airline (I do not have any gripe with them). However, on entering the hotel restaurant, it took a clear fifteen minutes before a waiter appeared with a menu.......we ordered two Chicken sandwiches, and it took a FULL HOUR (yes one full hour) to be served with our meal, and this in a restaurant in which I and my wife were the only patrons (the waiter indicated that they also had a party of 25 people in another area that were being served as a reason for the delay)......!! Amazing excuse in a hotel this big.......and then the waiter refused to book the bill to our room and requested CASH or Credit Card payment immediately........This matter I took up with the manager, who eventually agreed to credit the hotel with a sum from my credit card for payment of any incidentals at my expense over and above what the airline were paying for.....AFTER WE HAD HAD TO USE MY WIFE'S CREDIT CARD TO PAY FOR THE LUNCH! As seasoned travellers and property owners in Turkey I was astounded at the apparent LACK OF TRUST shown by staff of this hotel, particularly as our stay was enforced, and not of our own making, and as we were at the end of a 3 week vacation (which also started in Istanbul) our cash funds and things such as toiletries were at a low ebb. Even worse then that we find that there was ONE tiny bottle of shower gell in the bathroom, one small bar of soap, and NO HAIR SHAMPOO, and in the room itself - no tea or coffee making facilities, and the mini bar was devoid of EVERYTHING, it was stone cold empty. The manager was asked re tea/coffee facilities and his reply was a rather candid 'we don't have enough to put them into every room.' I was, though, very fortunate, at THE SECOND TIME OF ASKING to receive an adapter plug (which allowed me to use my laptop to complete much necessary business work caused by our delay) and of course write a review! At the time of writing we are awaiting an evening meal which we have been informed we 'have to take from a set menu'....I am not holding my breath, and at 12 TL for a (very small) beer and an incredible 6 TL for an (even smaller) cup of tea (chay) I don't think I need say any more. Would I recommend this hotel to any other buiness or leisure travellers....DEFINITELY NOT, and having travelled the globe extensively, I can quite categorically state this hotel is one of the poorest that I have had the pleasure to stay at, and I do not make such a statement lightheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “New hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lluis
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in ISG Hotel. The hotel is new. The rooms are so wonderful, big, really clean, big TV, nice WC, comfortable beds... The breakfast was ok: coffee, tea, bread, cereals, fruits, and typical Turkish breakfast, but there wasn't hot chocolate for breakfast. The hotel is in the airport but the access is not good. Is not possible to reeach the hotel walking. You have to take the shuttle free bus from the airport to the hotel. There is also an access from the terminal but nobody told us. There is only one computer with free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient quality hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KUNGFOOE10
Reviews.Content: ISG (Istanbul Sabiha Gokcen) airport hotel provided us with a perfect night's rest during a stopover earlier this month. The hotel is brand new so the rooms and facilities are obviously top notch, all areas are spotlessly clean, plus the beds are comfortable and the bedrooms well insulated from outside noise. The service and food were both top quality, and the value for money excellent considering there is no realistic alternative accommodation near the airport. The hotel seemed quiet when I was there but I have been told that the airport is growing rapidly and will soon become an important transfer hub, so there are 100+ rooms in the hotel in anticipation of future growth. The Turkish company who owns the hotel is called Limak, and they also own have four holiday resorts in the Turkish region of Antalya, as well as a city hotel in Ankara. Based on my happy experience in ISG, I would definitely consider staying in any of their hotels when I next come to Turkey"
